Detailed Description

An AbstractAppContext is attached to each Application by the Scheduler. AbstractAppContext provides the general interface and default implementations, and is meant to be extended by its subclasses.

Member Function Documentation

const Application* AbstractAppContext::GetApplication (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
The attached Application.

BOOLEAN AbstractAppContext::IsRunning (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE if the AbstractAppContext has been started, and its attached Application is ready to receive Messages.

virtual void AbstractAppContext::MsgLoop (   )  [pure virtual]
 

Subclasses implement this Message loop, which waits for Messages to be sent. Implementation dependent.

Implemented in AppContext, AppContext, and SimpleAppContext.

virtual void AbstractAppContext::SendMsg (  Message &  msg  )  [pure virtual]
 

Wakes up and sends a message to the attached Application. Implementation dependent.

Parameters:
msg A Reference to the Message to be sent

Implemented in AppContext, AppContext, and SimpleAppContext.

void AbstractAppContext::StartUp (   )  [virtual]
 

Sets up the AbstractAppContext for the attached Application. Subclass implementations should enter MsgLoop when done.

Reimplemented in AppContext, AppContext, and SimpleAppContext.

void AbstractAppContext::Stop (  void   )  [inline]
 

Stops the context. Subclass implementations should stop its MsgLoop.

virtual void AbstractAppContext::Wait (  const Condition &  cond  )  [pure virtual]
 

Stops program flow and waits for the Condition to become true. Implementation dependent.

Parameters:
cond A Reference to the Condition to wait for

Implemented in AppContext, AppContext, and SimpleAppContext.
